definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
(coll.) (Tw) troublesome customer/obnoxious guest (from Taiwanese 漚客|沤客, Tai-lo pr. [àu-kheh])
